title: Sort Three Numbers In A Stack

data.title: Sort Three Numbers In A Stack
data.statement:
Given three integers representing a stack, determine <<the shortest valid sequence of operations>> that will sort it in ascending order.

If the stack is <<already sorted>>, print
 {{sorted}}
If there are <<multiple sequences of minimal length>>, print a note 
 {{multiple minimal solutions exist}}

<<Operations>>

{{s}}
Swap the first two elements of a stack.
Example:
1 2 3 → 2 1 3

{{r}}
Rotate a stack: the first element becomes the last.
Example:
2 3 4 → 3 4 2

{{rr}}
Reverse rotate a stack: the last element becomes the first.
Example:
1 2 4 → 4 1 2
data.stubGenerator:
read a:int b:int c:int
write sa / ra / rra / sorted / or / multiple minimal solutions exist
data.inputDescription: <<Line 1>>: Three space-separated integers, [[a]], [[b]] and [[c]], representing the elements of a stack.
data.outputDescription:
<<One line>>: The shortest sequence of operations to sort the stack, or {{sorted}} if no operations are required.

If multiple minimal sequences exist print {{multiple minimal solutions exist}}

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Given three integers representing a stack, determine the shortest valid sequence of operations that will sort it in ascending order.

If the stack is already sorted, print
sorted
If there are multiple sequences of minimal length, print a note
multiple minimal solutions exist

Operations

s
Swap the first two elements of a stack.
Example:
1 2 3 → 2 1 3

r
Rotate a stack: the first element becomes the last.
Example:
2 3 4 → 3 4 2

rr
Reverse rotate a stack: the last element becomes the first.
Example:
1 2 4 → 4 1 2
Input
Line 1: Three space-separated integers, a, b and c, representing the elements of a stack.
Output
One line: The shortest sequence of operations to sort the stack, or sorted if no operations are required.

If multiple minimal sequences exist print multiple minimal solutions exist
Constraints
a, b, and c are all distinct.

0 ≤ a, b, c ≤ 10000
Example
Input
7 1 9
Output
s
